adjectives.description: solecist (comparative more solecist, superlative most solecist)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, rare) Having the characteristics of a solecism.
(obsolete, rare) One who commits a solecism.
examples: Shall a noble writer, and an inspired noble writer, be called a solecist, and barbarian, for giving a new turn to a word so agreeable to the analogy and genius of the Greek tongue?
